IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Scholar Leaders International exists to encourage and enable Christian theological leaders from the majority world for the global church.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Scholar Leaders International exists to encourage and enable Christian theological leaders from the Majority World - Africa, Asia, Central and Eastern Europe, Latin America, and the Middle East - for the Global Church. We do this through supporting leaders, guiding executives, engaging Majority World concerns and sharing knowledge across contexts.
IRS990.Desc: Leaderstudies - provide PhD-level scholarships and personal support for majority world scholars in theological studies.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Vital sustainability initiative - consult with executives at theological schools to clarify unique missions, define objectives, and formulate strategic plans.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Catalytic ventures - convene and resource leaders around specific topics, including equipping the church for ministry among other religions, advancing women leaders, and tackling other challenging issues facing the Church and society in their context.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: Other programs include InSights Journal & Scholar Leader of the Year

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part IV, Line 2b Explanation of escrow agreement
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Amounts received under fiscal sponsorship agreements with third-party beneficiaries are considered agency transactions. The Organization recognizes agency transactions as current assets and liabilities when received. The Organization recognizes a reduction in restricted cash and fiscal sponsorship liabilities when the assets are transferred to, or used on behalf of, the designated third-party beneficiary in accordance with the fiscal sponsorship agreement.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Scholar Leaders has a competitive selection process for choosing grant recipients. The process consists of a thorough application with references and academic transcripts, which is reviewed by the Leader Studies committee who make final selections. That committee consists of board members, including the academic and theological leaders listed on the board. Scholar Leaders typically offers grants to less than 15% of all applicants. All selected scholars must sign a four-way Covenant stating their commitment to service to the church in the majority world after graduation. During their studies, academic monitoring is maintained through semi-annual reviews, interviews and reports by their academic mentors. Whenever possible, grants are disbursed through the school at which the scholar is pursuing his/her degree. International wire transfers are facilitated by American Express International payments.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Securities - Publicly traded - The number of contributions represent the number of contributions received, not the number of items donated.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 1a Delegate broad authority to a committee
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Executive Committee (EC): EC is comprised of not less than four (4) Directors. EC shall encourage, and provide counsel and guidance to the President. EC shall approve the budget, consistent with the board-approved long-range plan. EC shall have and may exercise all of the authority of the Board of Directors, subject to the following exceptions: (1) EC may not authorize expenditures significantly in excess of the annual plan approved by the Board of Directors, except for emergency administrative cost authorizations. (2) EC may not amend the Articles of Incorporation, adopt a plan of merger or consolidation, approve the lease, exchange or other disposition of property and assets of the Corporation, dissolve the Corporation or amend the Bylaws of the Corporation. (3) EC may not hire the President or appoint the Chair, roles reserved for the entire board. EC members shall be nominated by the Chairman and elected by a majority of the Board of Directors at its annual meeting. The Chair and the President of the corporation shall be members of the EC. If possible, the EC will include the most recent past chair, ex-officio. EC shall meet no less than every two (2) months, between annual board meetings. EC shall be led by the Chair, who shall record any resolutions and distribute copies to all members of the Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 2 Family/business relationships amongst interested persons

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b Review of form 990 by governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990 is prepared by an independent CPA firm and reviewed in detail by the organization's President. The reviewed Form 990 is then provided to the board of directors prior to filing with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c Conflict of interest policy
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization requires all officers and board members to annually complete and sign a conflict of interest questionnaire. The Board Chair is responsible for reviewing the signed statements and ensuring that interested persons are in compliance with the conflict of interest policy. Either the Vice Chair or the Treasurer reviews the Board Chair's signed statement. Should any potential conflicts of interest be disclosed, the board member or officer would be asked to refrain from participation in any deliberation or decision with regard to matters affected by the relationship.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a Process to establish compensation of top management official
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The compensation for the President and other officers for each year, or the terms of compensation for a multi-year contract, will be established by the independent members of the board of directors. The board Executive Committee or the Staff Compensation and Benefits Committee researches and collects information regarding amounts paid by comparable organizations for comparable services in determining reasonable compensation. This process and the vote by the board is recorded in the board minutes.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b Process to establish compensation of other employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: See narrative for Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19 Required documents available to the public
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements are available upon request.
